= High Level =

* Text: .c, .cpp, .txt, .asm
	- Formatted 
		Stream oriented data files are subdivided into two categories.
	- Unformatted 
		It organizes data into blocks containing conditions bytes of information. The blocks 
		represent more complex data structures such as an array and structures. To process stream 
		oriented data data files, a seperate set of library functions are used. System oriented 
		data files are more closely related to the computer operating systems.
		
* Binary: .o, .exe, .elf, a.out, .mp3, .wav, .mp4 etc(all multimedia files)
